sentences.sContent: I find it hard to cope with change.

sentences.sCn: 为气候变化感到担忧的科学家们

sentences.sContent: A change in personality may mean your teenager has a drug problem.
sentences.sCn: 十几岁的孩子如果性格上发生了变化，可能意味着有吸毒问题。

sentences.sContent: No major changes were made to the book.
She had a change of heart (= change in attitude ) and decided to stay.
sentences.sCn: 她改变主意，决定留下来。

sentences.sContent: Family life has undergone dramatic change in recent years.
sentences.sCn: 近年来家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

sentences.sContent: ...who put herself through the fire of change to completely reinvent herself...
...conquering her inner resistance to change and making a firm commitment to take bigger steps...
...I’m not happy and I want to change and I’m done with this...
...Some people regard professional change as an unpleasant experience that disturbs their stable careers...
...you can shift the gear of it to change the speed anytime you like accordingly...
...it would attract funding and change the way we do health care...
...One educator named Dori Roberts decided to do something to change this system...
...People and homes are showing great change as more and more unique handcrafted items become available...

phrases.pCn: 为了改变一下；为了换换口味
全球变化；全世界性变化
改变心意；改变你的想法；改变你的观点
对换，对调位置；改变成；转接

words.tran: 无常的；可改变的；易变的；不定的
易变的；富于变化的；不稳定的
转换开关装置；改变者（change的名词形式）
改变（change的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the process or result of something or someone becoming different
